62 [Alle soulene day]
Alle soulene-day on vrþe : ri&yogh;ht is to holde hei&yogh;e:
For alle we schullen habben neode þar-to : for alle we schullen dei&yogh;e.
A fair si&yogh;ht þare-of al-so : þe Aungel þo gan bringue
Þene Manne of Rome ase he ladde him : ase he lay in metingue.
him þou&yogh;te, he sai&yogh;h manie men : liggen in beddes of golde,
And manie sitte at hey&yogh;e borde : and habbe al þat huy wolde;
And manie gon nakede : and bidde þat sum man heom scholde bi|weue,
And manie of-hongrede, and beden also : þat men sum guod heom eue.
¶ Þe Aungel him seide &yogh;wat it was : al þat he sai&yogh;h þere,
And þat it was purgatorie : and þe Men soulene were;
Þulke þat weren at so noble bord : and in þe riche beddes also,
Þat weren men for &yogh;wam þare was : muche guod on vrþe ido,
Þat bi-lefden freond bi-hynde heom : þat Massene leten singue
And duden guod for godes loue : heore soulene out of pine to bringue.
Þulke þat weren a-cale and of-hongred : þat no guod ne mi&yogh;hten finde,
Þat weren þulke þat nadden on vrþe : none freond hem bi-hinde
Ne for hem late[al. To lete for hem] masses singue : ne almes-dede for hem do;
Þare-fore ase helplese men : in Misayse huy &yogh;eoden so.
"Loke," quath þe Aungel, "þat þu telle : þe pope her-of sone,
Þat men holden alle soulene-day : for it is wel to done;
And also wide ase holie churche : þat he make is heste,
Þene a-morewe aftur alle halewene-day : to holde þulke feste,
Þat ech Man with guode wille : ase fer forth ase he may
For alle þe soulene in purgatorie : bidde þat ilke day;
So þat þe pouere þat nath no freond : þat for him bi name ou&yogh;ht do,
Þo[ru&yogh;][MS. þo] biddingue of ech cristine Man : i-holpe huy mowen beo so."
¶ Þe guode Man a-ros up a-non : þo he i-sai&yogh; al þis,
And þonkede god of þe si&yogh;hte— : and so he wel au&yogh;hte, i-wis.
Þe pope he tolde þat þo was : al þat he sai&yogh;h þere;
So þat men holdeth þulke feste[al. festen] : herre þane heo er were.—
Ore louerd bi-fond furst purgatorie : Men þuder in to wende
Þat hor[MS. for] penaunce here on vrþe : ne brou&yogh;hten nou&yogh;t[MS. non] to ende,
And þat Men for simple sunnes : of &yogh;wan i-schriue hy nere[MS. were]
In þulke torment huy bi-lefden : for-to hy i-bette were;
And Men al-so þat weren i-schriue : and heore schrift a-fengue also
Of a fol preost, and nou&yogh;ht i-nou&yogh; : to þe sunne þat was i-do,
Þulke schullen so to purgatorie : for-to huy habben to ende i-brou&yogh;ht
penaunce a-cordinde to heore sunne : and aftur þe preostes nou&yogh;ht.[al. 4 vv. more.]
&YOGH;if heo is more þane þe sunne : and a man it do, i-wis,
Al it schal in heouene tuyrne : to echingue of his blis;
&YOGH;if heo is euene to his sunne : þe sunne heo wole a-quenche,
Ake nou&yogh;ht &yogh;if heo to luytel is. : þare-fore ech man him bi-þenche
And to a fol preost ne triste nou&yogh;ht : þat to luyte penaunce him set;
For soþe, here oþur elles-&yogh;ware : ech sunne worth i-bet.
&YOGH;wat, hou is hit þanne of Ianekin : and of robinet þe wilde,
Of annot and of Malekin : þat wollez habbe þene preost so milde,
And huy seggez, "þilke preost is to hard : god schilde us fram is lothþ;
go we to sire Gilbert þe preost : he nis neuere wrothþ,
¶ he wollez schriue us nessche i-nou&yogh; : and ore sunnes al for-&yogh;yue."
bi god, &yogh;wane huy habbez al ido : hom huy gothþ vn-schriue;
For heore penaunce schal beo so luyte : þat sire Gilbert and huy also
Schullen gon a-deuelewey : bote god nime &yogh;eme heom to.—
In purgatorie nis no confort : bote of one þingue :
of þe hope of Ioye aftur-ward : þat ore louerd heom wole bringue.—
&YOGH;wane Men in heore deth-beddes beoth : and heore penaunce heom is i-set,
And huy ne mouwen nou&yogh;ht on eorþe beo : for-to heo beo ful bet,
So repentaunt huy mouwen beo : þat ore louerd it wole for-&yogh;yue
With-outen any purgatorie : &yogh;wan huy beoth wel i-schriue.
Ake &yogh;if his penaunce him is i-&yogh;yue : &yogh;wane he mot heonne wende,
Of þat he is i-schriue : and he ne may it bringue to ende,
On of his nexte freond mi&yogh;hte : for him it swiþe wel do.
Ake four þingus he moste habbe : þat scholde take on so :
Furst þare moste gret loue beo : bi-twene &yogh;wam so it were—
For with-oute loue and deol of heorte : swuch þing nou&yogh;ht[al. no&yogh;t worþ] nere;
Ake &yogh;if huy weren al-so of one blode : þe betere it were, i-wis—
Ake studefast heorte of guod loue : þe maistrie þar-of is.
¶ Þat oþur þing is þat he schal : þoru&yogh;h deþe heonne wiende
And þat he ne may habbe no space here : his penaunce bringue to ende.
Þe þridde þing is þat hit beo : þoru&yogh;h þe preostes rede,
For no man ne may þare-with-oute : wel endi swuch dede.
Þe feorþe þing is þat men him take : penaunce more þare-to
Þane him þat þe sunne dude : &yogh;if he mi&yogh;hte penaunce do;
For ho-so wole for oþeres sunne : swuch penaunce here lede,
More penaunce man mot heom sette : þane him þat dude þe dede.
¶ Þare-fore &yogh;wane anie of ouwer freond : hath i-brou&yogh;ht is lif to fine,
I-seoth here hou &yogh;e mouwen bringue him : out of his pine;
to biete is sunne in þis manere : sikerliche &yogh;e mouwen eou beode.
For godus loue þenchez þaron : &yogh;wane ouwer freond habbez neode!—
In &yogh;wuch stude is nouþe purgatorie : manie wolden fayn i-wite.
hit [nis][om.] nou&yogh;ht a[al. in o] stude to alle men : ake in fif studes, it is i-write :
¶ On is in þe firmament : þare gret brenningue is
Of fuyr þat hath þare is stude : and of þe sonne, i-wis.
Þat oþur is in þe Eyr a-bouen us here : þare luþere gostes fleoth
Þat tormentiez heom ny&yogh;ht and day : and neuere in reste ne beoth.
Þe þridde is an vrþe a-mong us here. : þe feorþe in watere is.
Þe fifte is onder vrþe deope : bi-side helle, i-wis —
¶ Seint patrik on vrþe &yogh;wilene : ane stude þar-of founde,
Ase god wolde, bi-side þe hul : of seint brendan in his londe.[al. Irlond]
For four þingus purgatorie : in þeos fif studen is :
For sum Man scholde lasse torment : þane oþur habbe, i-wis;
And þat men mi&yogh;hten þorou&yogh;h god dede : þe sonore to Ioye heom bringue;
And þat men weren þoru&yogh;h hem i-war : bi a vision oþur metingue;
And for men[r. man] þat delitiez muche in sunne : in one place,
Þare he schal þe sunne biete : for-to ore louerd him &yogh;iue grace.—
¶ One tale and one faire en-saunple : þare-of we findez i-write,
Þat[al. for] ore louerd schewez us swuch þing : for we scholden þe soþe i-wite.
A preost was &yogh;wilene in one stude : þat dude him baþie i-lome
In one stude priueliche : þare none men ne come.
So þat þare cam ofte a man : ase hit were bi cas,
And seruede him and wuchs him wel— : ake he nuste &yogh;wat he was.
A day he made halibred : and þe manne hit bi-tok
Ase for is mede for is swunch. : ake he it anon for-sok;
¶ "Sire," he seide, "ine may hit nou&yogh;ht : for it i-halewed is,
And for i-nam nou&yogh;ht holi &yogh;uyt : i-ne may it nau&yogh;t, i-wis."
"A-godes name," quath þe preost : "ich hote and halsnie þe
Þat þou me segge &yogh;wat þou art : þat þus ofte comest to me."
"Ich was &yogh;wylene of þis stude : louerd," þis oþur seide,
"In þis place ich delitede muche : to don a mis-dede,
And al mi delift[al. delit] of þulke sunne : so was in þis place;
I-ne bette nou&yogh;ht þe sunne a-liue : for ich nadde nou&yogh;ht þe grace,
And aftur mi deth þere-fore : mi purgatorie here is,
to biete mi sunne in þulke place : þare ase ich dude amis.
And &yogh;if þou woldest[al. Ac woldestou] for me massene singue : ich mi&yogh;hte habbe milce and ore;
And þou mi&yogh;ht i-wyte þat ich am sauf : &yogh;wane þou ne finst me nonmore."
Þe preost song for him Massene fiue : and oþur guodnesse dude also.
Sone he miste þat selie gost : &yogh;uyt are þe seueny&yogh;ht weren i-do :
For he wende to þe Ioye of heouene : þat he deore a-bou&yogh;hte.
Þus Mani Man hath his purgatorie : þare he is sunne wrou&yogh;hte.
So may parauentur dame Aldith : þat nath non oþur blis
bote athom in hire halle clene : þere ase hire Moker is,
Þat, þei heo bidde hire beden at churche : hire þou&yogh;ht is athom more;
parauenture heo schal it bete þare : and a-bugge hire loue ful sore!—
Men habbuz here heore purgatorie : manie for swuche þingue,
And manie to warni some men : to helpe heom þarof to bringue.
Mani man his purgatorie : in wature hath al-so :
Þarof ichulle one ensaumple segge : of þat &yogh;wilene was ido.—
¶ Seint Tebaud þe bischop hadde : in his fot ane hote goute,
Þat poudagre icleopeod is— : he hadde þere-offe gret doute.
Ase his fischares wenden a-fischez : in heruest al-a-boute,
In heor net huy nomen ane clompe of .Is[MS. ys?]. : huy weren þare-with wel proute :
For þat ys þat was so cold : i-leid to heore louerdes fote
hit[MS. þat] wolde aswagi þe hote goute : and bringue him sum bote.
Þis bischop tebaut was wel glad. : þat ys huy leiden oft
to is fot, and eche time : it made him liþe and softe.
Þat ys was euere hol and sound : it ne malt for none hete.
Seint tebaut þou&yogh;hte þare-of wonder : for no-þing he nolde it lete.
A luyte cri him þou&yogh;hte a day : in þat ys he heorde þere.
he coniourede hit a-godes name : to segge him &yogh;wat it were.
"Ich am," quath þis oþur, "a seli gost : and in þis ys ich am her
In mi purgatorie, forte ich beo : of mine sunnes scker.
Ake &yogh;if þou woldest for godesloue : þritti masses singue
For me, ich wot þat þu mi&yogh;htest : of þis pine me bringue."
Þe bischop grauntede him wel sone : and bi-gan a-non a-morewe
Þe Massene for þis selie gost : to bringuen it out of soruwe,
And ech day song so aftur oþur. : þe deuel hadde þerto gret onde
Þe &yogh;uyt þat gost scholde of pine come— : his wrench he gan fonde.
For ase þe bischop þene tenþe day : bi-gan is masse to singue,
Al þe toun þe feondes hadde : i-brou&yogh;t on a fi&yogh;htyngue.
Þe guode man bi-lefde is masse a-non : and orn a-mong heom faste,
And harmles þoru&yogh;h godes grace : a-passede[al. paisede] heom atþe laste.
Ase he bi-gan a-morewe is masse : a gret cri þare cam al-a-boute
Þat þe toun bi-seged was : with gret ferd al with-oute,
And Men ornen into al þe toun : ase witlese for doute.
Þe bischop lefde is masse a-non : and orn to-ward þe route;
He made pays a-&yogh;ein þat fierd : þat huy no-þing ne reueden.
Ake natheles so þeo tuey dawes : his masse he bi-leuede.
¶ Ase he bi-gan is masse þene þridde day : men heten out al-a-boute,
For is court and muche of þe toun : a-fuyre was with-oute.
"Þei it al fur-berne," quath þe bischop : "and ich mi-sulf also,
I-nelle to-day fram þis weued : are þis masse beo i-do."
So þat he song is masse forth : and muche folk was bisi with-oute
to lauien watur and quienche þat fuyr : þat orn so wide a-boute.
Þo þe Masse was i-do : þat fuyr a-queynte anon;
Þare nas a-peired nou&yogh;ht an hous : ake hole stoden echon.[MS. achon]
¶ Þulke þreo dawes þe deouel hadde : al þulke wo i-do
his masse forto lette : and pini þe soule so.
Þe bischop fond þat .ys. athom : i-molten al to nou&yogh;hte :
Þo wuste he þat þoru is Masse : to Ioye þe soule he brou&yogh;hte.—
Manie þingus one soule helpez : þat in purgatorie is;
Ake þreo þingues heom helpez mest : bi-fore alle oþere, i-wis :
beden of Men, and almes-dede : singuingue of Masses al-so—
Þeos þreo þingues beoth best, i-wis : and mest guod huy wollez do.—
¶ Þat biddingue of beden beoth guode : þe soþe &yogh;e mouwen i-wite
bi a tale of a clerk : þat we findez i-write.
A clerk hadd[e] &yogh;wilene ane wone : bi churche-hey&yogh;e &yogh;wane he come,
to segge for alle cristine soulene : þe "deprofundis" i-lome.
In a churche-&yogh;erd ones he cam late : þeoues him comen a-boute
And a-saileden him to robbi : he nuste &yogh;wat do for doute.
Þe bodies þat weren i-burede þare : his beden &yogh;olden a-non :
huy comen with wepnen him forto helpe : and sturten forth echon,
euer-ech with swuch-manere wepne : ase huy uyseden here a-liue,
plou&yogh;-Man with his Aker-staf : Archer mid bouwe and knyue;
A-boute þis þeoues huy comen ech-one : and guonne heom sone to-driue,
And to heore puttes wenden sethþe a-&yogh;ein : þis clerk hamward wel bliue.
Þus weren is beden i-&yogh;olde : þat he bad erore and ofte.
Ich am siker, þe þeoues[þe þ. on the margin.] ne &yogh;eoden nou&yogh;ht : aweywardes ful softe :
For ich wot wel þat non of us : ne hadde heom so sore a-gast!
A wonder bataille it was on : hadde it longue i-last;
Ich wene, þei ani chaumpiun : þare hadde i-beo,
Sone he wolde habbe i-nome is red : hamward for-to fleo!—
Almes-dede deth þe soule also : swiþe gret guod with-alle :
Þat &yogh;e mouwen bi a cas i-seo : þat ane kny&yogh;hte dude bi-falle.
¶ A guod man &yogh;wyle, þat hei&yogh;te steuene : to is endingue drou&yogh;.
A kny&yogh;ht, his freond, for is deth : made gret deol i-nou&yogh;
And dude for him grete almes-dede : boþe ni&yogh;ht and day.
Þarof he i-sai&yogh; a fair bi-tokningue : ase he a-slepe lay :
him þou&yogh;hte he sai&yogh; a sluper brugge : swyþe fayr and hei&yogh;,
A deop watur and swart bi-neoþe : a fair mede þare was nei&yogh;
with swote smul and faire floures. : and ope þe brugge he sei&yogh;[MS. gan] gon
with grete Misayse mani Men : þat fullen into þat watur a-non,
And manie he sai&yogh; þare-oppe gon : al-sauf with-oute drede,
And manie with Ioye and blisse i-nou&yogh; : pleyinde in þe Mede.
Ope þe brugge him þou&yogh;hte he sai&yogh; : gon in wrechhede
Steuene, for &yogh;wam þat he dude : þe grete almes-dede;
Blake men þare weren bi-neoþe : þat a-doneward him drowe,
And oþere þare weren in &yogh;wite cloþes : þat opward him heolden i-nowe;
bi-twene heom laste þe noyse longue : a&yogh;ein oþur ech drou&yogh; faste,
Ake euere hadden þe &yogh;wite Men : þe maistrie at þe laste.
Þat weren þe almesdedes : þat for him weren i-do,
Þat þe kny&yogh;ht for is soule dude : þat drowen him opward so.
¶ Þe blake þat him a-doneward drowen : þat weren is luþere dedes,
Þat wolden him to pine drawe : &yogh;if huy mi&yogh;hten for almes-dede.—
Massene also doth gret guod : boþe þe quike and dede :
Þat &yogh;e mouwen i-heore bi þis tale : and bi oþure þat ich er sede.
¶ Men weren &yogh;wilene in a contreye : þare a gret ston-roche stod,
And Men wenden þat þare-onder were : gret tresor[MS. trosor] and guod :
So þat huy doluen þare-aftur : ake to wroþerhele ate laste :
For opon hem ful þe roche adoun : and heom alle ouer-caste,
And a-slou&yogh; heom alle, bote anne Man : þat, ase it were bi cas,
In a-manere dich fel and lay : and þe roche a-boue him was;
So þat he ne mi&yogh;hte of þe stude : ase i-putted he lay þere.
his wyf nuste nou&yogh;ht of is lyf : ake wende þat he ded were :
to churche heo wende euerech day : ane masse to leten singue,
A lof and wyn and a candel of wex : to þe weued heo wolde bringue,
And al for hire louerdes soule— : heo ne bi-lefde nou&yogh;ht a day.
Þe deuel hadde þarto gret onde : þo he þat i-sai&yogh; :
¶ Ase þis wyf &yogh;eode a day toward churche : þe deuel cam hire to
And seide þat heo &yogh;eode for nau&yogh;ht : for þe Masse was i-do.
Þat guode wyf &yogh;eode hom a-&yogh;ein : and wende þat he soth sede.
A-morewe he made hire al-so gon hom : mid þulke sulue dede;
And þane þridde day al-so guod. : ake þat wyf þane feorþe day
Sone a-ros and to churche &yogh;eode : þo heo þane day i-sai&yogh;h.
&YOGH;uyt cam þe schrewe and seide : þat þe Masse was i-do.
Þis wyf i-liefde him er fule wel : ake þo nolde heo nou&yogh;ht so,
Ake wende to churche, and fond þe soþe : of þat þe schrewe hire mette,
Þat it was to bi-trayen hire : and guodnesse to lette.
¶ Sone hit bi-feol þare-afturward : þat Men of þe toune
wenden to bete op þulke roche : þat so lay þare a-doune,
And wenden to finde sum tresor. : huy doluen and beoten faste.
Þe selie Man bi-neoþe was of-drad : þat huy more opon him caste;
"Deluez," he seide, "warliche : þat &yogh;e ne slen me nou&yogh;ht!"
Þo weren þis Men sore a-dradde : and stoden in gret þou&yogh;ht;
Ake naþeles huy doluen bi-side : so þat huy to him come.
huy founden him ligge hol and sound : and with Ioye hine up nome.
huy axeden him hou he hadde i-leoued : þat hongur him ne a-slou&yogh;.
"Certes," he seide, "ich habbe i-haued : mete and drinke i-nou&yogh; :
For a lof and a picher wyn : Mi wyf me sende ech day,
And a brennind candle : þat me li&yogh;hte þe &yogh;wile ich here lay.
bote þreo dawes þis oþur wike : no-þing heo me ne sende;
Ich was nei&yogh;h for hongur ded.: ake heo gan sone a-mende
And sende me ase heo dude er : and fedde me wel with-alle.
Of alle wyues worþe hire best : and best hire mote bi-falle!"
bi þis Miracle man may i-seo : and bi manie oþure al-so,
Þat Massene and almes-dede : gret guod þe soule wollez do.—
Þis guodnesses nellez nou&yogh;ht helpe : alle i-liche, i-wis;
For of Men þat heonne wiendez : mani-manere þare is :
Oþur ri&yogh;ht guode, oþur ri&yogh;ht vuele : oþur ri&yogh;ht[om. ri&yogh;ht] bi-tweone two.
goddede helpez some ful luyte : þat man wole for heom do,
&YOGH;if þat huy ri&yogh;ht guode beoz— : huy ne habbuth none neode mid-alle
to none erþeliche guodnesse : þat heom mi&yogh;hte þare bi-falle;
For in þe Ioye of heouene huy buth : ase huy weren bi-fore.
Ake naþeles þat men for heom doth : ne worth nou&yogh;ht for-lore :
For it schal him-sulf helpe muche : þat þulke guodnesse deth,
And alle cristine soulene also : þat in purgatorie beoth.
¶ Þreo-manere men þare buth ri&yogh;ht guode : þat to heouene wiendez a-non
&YOGH;wane huy out of þis worlde farez. : &yogh;ung child is þat on
Þat deide aftur is cristinedom : are hit dude to quede;
And Martyrs þat for godes loue : in strong torment weren dede;
Þe þridde manere so but clene men : þat are þat huy heonnes wende,
Alle heore sunnes betten here : ase ore louerd heom grace sende.
Þis þreo-manere men ne mouwen nou&yogh;ht : in purgatorie bi-leue,
Ake smitez þoru-out quiclokur : þane þe leyte doth an eue;
huy ne mouwen nou&yogh;ht bi-leue þare : for er heo wenden heonne,
Clene huy weren of alle sunne : and ne habbut noþing[MS. noþint] to brenne.
For ase wode and col fedez : þat fuyr þat here is,
Al-so sunne fet þat fuyr : in purgatorie, i-wis;
And &yogh;wan þe sunne is i-brend a-wey : þe soule to heuene geth,
Ake wel sone þoru&yogh; he flieth : þat in clannesse þolede deth.
Also doth [þe][om.; H þulke] þreo-manere Men : of &yogh;wan ich eou er seide :
For heouene openez a&yogh;enes heom : so sone ase heo beoth dede.—
And þat it beo soth of alle þreo : ensaumple &yogh;e mouwen i-seo.
Þat a&yogh;ein children i-baptizede : heouene i-opened beo :
For ore louerd was nyne-and-twenti &yogh;er : and twelf daywes old
Are he i-baptized were : ase þe bok us hath i-told :
Of al þat tyme non eorþelich Man : ne mi&yogh;hte enes i-wite
Þat heouene openede ou&yogh;were aboue : þat we findez i-write;
bote þo he was i-baptized : of þe holie Man seint Iohan,
A-boue his heued with gret li&yogh;ht : heouene openede a-non.
&YOGH;wat bi-tocknede þulke openingue : þat þo was and er nou&yogh;ht,
bote þat þoru[overlined.] cristindom : Man was to heouene i-brou&yogh;t,
And þat heouene-dore was faste i-mad : for-to cristindom were,
And þat a-&yogh;ein þe furste cristindom : heouene openede þere;
And þat heouene-dore i-opened is : to cristine Men al-so,
And to &yogh;ongue children forto huy habben : þoru&yogh; sunne it fur-do?
For huy schullen, &yogh;wane huy heonnes wiendez : heouene-dore opene finde,
For huy ne berez with heom no sunne : þat drawe heom bi-hinde;
Also quicliche ase li&yogh;httingue : þoru purgatorie huy doz gon,
And heouene-dore findez opene : and wiendez in anon.
gret folie it is to weope : ase Men beoz i-wonet to done,
For &yogh;ongue children þat dei&yogh;ez so : þat in heouene buth so sone!
"Awei, mi child," seith þe damme : and suou&yogh;nez a-&yogh;ein þe wowe;
bi crist, heo au&yogh;te þonki god : þat nam hit ase his owe!—
¶ A-&yogh;ein þe Martyrs þat guode buth : heouene i-opened is :
Þat Man may bi þe Martyrdom iseo : of seint steuene, i-wis.
For þo men him to deþe þreowen : he bi-heold to heouene an hei&yogh;h :
An heouene openede a-non : ase he þare i-sei&yogh;h—
"Lo," he seide, "nouþe ich i-seo : þoru&yogh; ihesu cristes sonde
heouene opene, and godes sone : in is fader ri&yogh;th hond stonde."
And þe furste martyr he was : þat euere on vrþe cam
Aftur godes passion : to holde up cristindom :
heouene openede a&yogh;en him : ase he þene deth nam,
to bi-tokni þat he wolde al-so : a&yogh;en ech þat þolede guod Martyrdom.
And þei he were sum-del in sunne : heore deth þat huy nome
And heore blod heom wolde wasche : are huy to purgatorie come.—
Þulke also of clene liue : þat in clennesse here lif endiez,
heouene openez a-&yogh;ein heom : &yogh;wane huy heonne wiendez :
Þat Man may i-seo bi ensaumple : of seint Iohan þe wangelist.
Clannore þane he was, no man nas : with-oute Iesu crist.
he seith in þe Apocalips— : þat a wel guod bok is,
Þat he i-sei&yogh;h heouene-dore : a-&yogh;en him opene, i-wis.
&YOGH;wat bi-toknede þat bote þis : huy scholden i-seo also
A-&yogh;ein heom, alle þat clene weren : heouene-dore vndo?—
Erþelich guodnesse helpez luyte : swyche Men, i-wisse,
For huy nabbuth þare-to non neode : &yogh;wane huy beoth in heuene|blisse.
Ake þanne it helpez him-sulf muche : þat deth þulke goddede,
And alle þat beoth in purgatorie : ase ich erore sede.

Any guod-nesse þat Man may : on vrþe for him do;
¶ For seint Austyn seith, &yogh;if he wuste : þat is fader in helle were,
Non more he nolde for him bidde : þane for ane deuel þere.
Ake euere it helpez him þat it dothþ : and cristine soulene al-so;
For no guodnesse ne worth fur-lore : þat Man may on vrþe do. —
Ake beden oþer oþure[al. om.] almes-dedes luyte helpuz : of fremde oþur of kunne,
bote he with-oute wrathþe beo : and with-oute dedlich sunne.
Ake a masse nis noþe-worse : for[r. of] &yogh;wam þat heo is i-do,
Þei it beo of a sunful preost— : of non oþur þing it nis so.
For þat dede is so hei&yogh;h : þat heo ne may a-peyri nou&yogh;ht
Of[al. For] no wrechche preost þat it dez : þei he beo in sunne i-brou&yogh;ht.
Ake þei þe Masse ne beo þe worse : þe preost, bi mi swere,
Þat hire singuth in dedlich sunne : a-corie it schal ful deore!
For &yogh;wane sire Gileberd i-massed hath : his lif he wole so di&yogh;hte
Atþe tauerne to beon a-day : and bi is quene bi ny&yogh;hte;
he seith, &yogh;wane Men cleopiez him preost : "sittez stille, mine guode i-fere,
Þe preost hanguez at churche : and ich am nouþe here"—
¶ his cope oþur is surplis : þe preost he seith it isse;
Ake his cope schal bi-leue at hom : &yogh;wane he schal to helle, i-wisse!—
ho-so wole &yogh;wane he is ded[al. þat a ded man,] : to[of] his guodnesse a-fongue,
do it bi-time for þe dede : þare-aftur þinkez longue.
And þat it beo soth, man may i-s[e]o[MS. so] : bi a wonder cas
Þat &yogh;wylene bi a kny&yogh;ht bi-feol : þat with þe hei&yogh;e kyng charles was.
¶ Þe kyng Charles his Ost aday : to strongue batayle gan lede.
his .O. kny&yogh;ht þat with him wende : of þe deþe gan him drede.
A cosyn he hadde in þe route : to him he þou&yogh;hte he mi&yogh;hte
best truste[r. truste to] of alle Men : and so he au&yogh;hte with ri&yogh;hte;
"Cosyn," he seide, "&yogh;if ich am : here to deþe i-brou&yogh;ht,
Sul Mi stede and do[r. do guod?] for mi soule : ne bi-lef þou it nou&yogh;ht!"
Þis kni&yogh;ht truste wel to is word : þat grauntede don is bone;
And in-to þe batayle wende forth : ase ri&yogh;ht was for-to done,
And fau&yogh;ht þe &yogh;wyle he mi&yogh;hte : and a-slawe was at þen ende.
his cosin nam his stede sone : and hamward he gan wiende,
And to is owene bi-hofþe faste ire heold : and þou&yogh;hte forto done
Also muche guod for þe kny&yogh;htes soule : &yogh;wane he mi&yogh;hte eft-sone.
¶ Þe kny&yogh;ht cam to him eft-sone : gostliche in priuete,
"Cosyn," he seide, "late þou dudest : þat þou bi-hei&yogh;htest me!
Þou madest me beon in purgatorie : seue ny&yogh;ht, mid-i-wisse.
And nouþe ich am in heouene : and þarof þou schalt misse,
For þou schalt in þis ilke day : to þe pine of helle wende,
For þe treson þat þou me dudest : and beon þare with-outen ende."
Þis gost wende forth a-non : and þe false Man wel sone
deide, and wende a-deuele wey : ase he of-seruede to done.
here mouwen þis false esecutores : beon[MS. bieon] i-warre bi þis tale,
Þat muche habbez of dedes godes : and deleth þare-of ful smale,
Ake þenchez, &yogh;wane huy riche beoth : to &yogh;elden it wel, i-wis;
Þe soule longueth þare-aftur-ward[al. þerafter sore] : þat in purgatorie is,
heo a-bidez longue heore richesse : þe guode is euere bi-hinde—
huy schullen gon a-deouele wey : and þare heore miede finde.
Nou Ihesus, þat us deore bou&yogh;hte : þei we don ofte a-mis,
On alle cristine soulene haue merci : and bring us to heuene blis,
And led us to oure ri&yogh;hte heritage : for þou bou&yogh;htest us þar-to;
Ne leos nou&yogh;ht þat þou deore bou&yogh;htest : þei we sumdel mis-do!
